column9: Founded Christmas Eve 1741 by Count Zinzendorf and Moravian missionaries; became headquarters of Moravian activity in North America.
Settlement established 1740; Nazareth Hall later served as key Moravian educational center.
Founded 1756; became one of the major Moravian settlements in Pennsylvania.
Organized 1759; originally named Salisbury; developed as communal village along Bethlehem model.
Founded 1753; first Moravian settlement in North Carolina; precursor to Salem and Wachovia tract communities.
Established 1766; became principal congregation of Southern Province.
Moravian missionaries established mission in 1735; abandoned 1740 due to conflicts and local hostility.
Founded 1749; offshoot from Bethlehem; incorporated communal economy until late 18th century.
Mission to Native Americans; founded 1746; destroyed during French and Indian War (1755).
Organized 1763; one of the earliest Moravian congregations in New York region.
